title: [Cancer] Nutrient found in beef and dairy improves immune response to cancer. Trans-vaccenic acid (TVA), a long-chain fatty acid found in meat and dairy products from grazing animals such as cows and sheep, improves the ability of CD8+ T cells to infiltrate tumors and kill cancer cells.

[Neuroscience] Brainstem recording in mice shows that tastebuds are the first line of defense against eating too fast, suggesting that our sense of taste may help pace our eating. One part of the brain is saying, “This tastes good, eat more,” and another part is saying, “Slow down or you’re going to be sick.”
